Quoting "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains762@...>:
> That said, I propose that one can derive the entire body of OOD theory
> armed with nothing more than the four principles of simple design
> (Passes Tests, Minimizes Duplication, Communicates Well, Minimizes
> Complexity). I have a proof, but the margin is too small to contain it.

Cute. Proofs are nice, but I just use the vast majority of software  
out there as the basis for my point: all this belief in holistic  
design and "the big picture" hasn't done a whole lot toward producing  
systems that can be sustainably maintained at reasonable cost. Most  
systems contain lots of terrible code written to support an adequate  
up-front design, one that at best represented a "good guess" of how to  
lay out the system.

Jeff
